III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An unknown youth was forced to participate in sex trafficking by a
staff.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 4/15/24.
Complainant reported he learned of the allegations from Youth A,
who is a former youth of the facility. Complainant did not have any
further details.
Youth A was interviewed via TEAMS video conference on
4/15/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
the first name of the youth who provided her the information but
couldn’t remember her last name. Youth A reported the youth who
told her the information was adopted after she left the facility.
Youth A reported she was told Staff 1 mentored a couple female
youth after they left the facility, including the youth who told Youth
A this information, and brought them into sex trafficking. Youth A
reported she was not told the names of any of the other youth.
Youth A reported the youth who told her this information stated
Staff 1 forced her to have sex with his friends. Youth A reported
this situation has been investigated already and Staff 1 went to jail
because of it. Youth A reported she heard he went to jail from a
Facebook post, but she cannot remember who posted it.
Youth B was interviewed via phone on 4/16/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Youth B is the only youth placed at the
facility at the same time as Youth A who has the same first
name as the youth who allegedly shared the allegations with
Youth A. Youth B reported she remembered Youth A. Youth B
reported they were placed in Rose Hall at the facility at the same
time. Youth B reported she doesn’t remember Staff 1 ever being in
Rose Hall. Youth B reported Staff 1 would be outside playing
basketball with some of the youth when they had outdoor time.
Youth B reported Staff 1 was quiet and didn’t talk much. Youth B
reported she never had any concerns about him except she
thought he stared at her chest or butt sometimes. Youth B
reported she never had any contact with Staff 1 after she left the
facility, never had any sexual contact with Staff 1 or his friends,
and never talked to Youth A about Staff 1.
2

Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
4/16/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
reported Staff 1 did not complete aftercare services for youth, so
there would be no reason for him to have contact with any youth
after they left the facility. Administrator reported he has never
heard of Staff 1 mentoring any youth after they left the facility.
Administrator reported Staff 1 worked primarily in Donna Maria
Hall, which was part of the Vista Maria Specialty License.
However, Donna Maria Hall was closed, and all the youth moved
to Rose Hall around 10/15/2020. Rose Hall was part of the Vista
Maria Mental Health License, which is where Youth A and Youth B
were placed. Administrator reported Staff 1 would have begun
working primarily in Rose Hall at the same time. Administrator
reported there were no grievance or complaints against Staff 1
until a MDHHS Investigation involving Youth C in early 2021.
Administrator reported he doesn’t remember anything specifically
about Staff 1 except for that investigation. Administrator reported
Youth A could have had contact during school with other youth
with the same first name as Youth B, but they might have been
placed under a different Vista Maria license.
Supervisor was interviewed via TEAMS video conference on
4/24/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported she was the unit manager of Donna Maria Hall and
witnessed many interactions between various youth and Staff 1
while he worked at the facility. Supervisor reported all the
interactions she witnessed were appropriate and he had great
rapport with the youth. Supervisor reported she never had any
complaints about Staff 1 regarding boundary issues or sex
trafficking. Supervisor reported she never worked in Rose Hall, so
she did not witness any of Staff 1’s interactions with youth there.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 4/16/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he worked part-time at the
facility from late 2020-early 2021. Staff 1 reported he stopped
working at the facility after there was a false complaint made
against him in early 2021 involving Youth C. Staff 1 reported he
didn’t feel like there was any protection for him, and he didn’t want
to take the chance of any other false claims coming forward
because he had his own kids and family to think about. Staff 1
reported he thinks he remembers a youth with the same first name
as Youth B in Rose Hall, but reported Youth B’s last name didn’t
sound familiar. Staff 1 reported he has never had any contact with
any youth outside of the facility, never mentored any youth from
the facility, never had any sexual relations with any youth at the
3

facility, never had any youth have sexual relations with his friends,
and never participated in any form of sex trafficking. Staff 1
reported he never had any sexual contact or inappropriate contact
with any youth while they were placed at the facility either. Staff 1
reported he was strictly business and professional while he was
working there. Staff 1 reported if he ever heard any rumors going
on about him from any of the youth, he immediately told Human
Resources or his direct supervisor because he didn’t want to be
involved in any of it.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Allegations were reviewed for all special investigations
completed by DCWL for all four Vista Maria licenses
between 2020-2021 and these allegations, or allegations
similar, have not been investigated previously.
• MiSACWIS shows there was one MDHHS Investigation
(#105622803) dated 4/22/21 involving Staff 1. Allegations
stated in March 2021, Staff 1 took Youth C to Dave and
Busters, and they had sex afterwards, but it is unknown if
the sex was consensual. DCWL was not involved in this
investigation because allegations reported it happened
after Youth C left the facility. Youth C and Staff 1 both
denied anything sexual happened between them. Youth
and Staff interviewed during the investigation denied any
concerns regarding Staff 1 or Staff 1 being inappropriate
with youth at the facility. There were no findings in the
investigation.
• Facility has one grievance complaint against Staff 1 from
early 2021 related to MDHHS Investigation #105622803,
which involved Youth C. There were no findings.
• License #CI820294390 (Vista Maria) MiSACWIS placement
history did not have any youth placed with the first name
Youth A provided during the timeframe Youth A was placed
at the facility.
• License #CI820201488 (Vista Maria Specialty) MiSACWIS
placement history did not have any youth placed with the
first name Youth A provided during the timeframe Youth A
was placed at the facility.
• License #CI820201487 (Vista Maria Open Residential)
MiSACWIS placement history did not have any youth
4

placed with the first name Youth A provided during the
timeframe Youth A was placed at the facility.
• License #CI820272493 (Vista Maria Mental Health)
MiSACWIS placement history shows Youth B is the only
person with her first name placed at the facility during the
same timeframe as Youth A. Youth C was placed at the
same time as Youth A.
o Youth A was placed from 2/10/20-10/9/20.
o Youth B was placed from 8/18/20-12/22/20.
o Youth C was placed from 7/11/20-11/9/20.
• Staff and Client Interaction Policy states all Vista Maria staff
should conduct themselves in a professional and
appropriate manner when interacting with youth. Never give
out personal telephone numbers or address to youth. Do
not transport current or former clients you may see in the
community without prior authorization. If you receive any
correspondence from a youth, bring it to a supervisor’s
attention immediately. Staff should never present
themselves in a manner that could be construed as
flirtatious or sexual in nature to youth.
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary action in his employee file,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 received training on
the employee handbook and policies on 10/11/17.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as based on interviews
conducted and documentation reviewed Youth B and Staff 1 both
denied the allegations and there was no other supporting
information found.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
